result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  NO CONTACT with Eric T or his residence.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 15, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to stop at DA's office to make appointment.

Court adjourned at 8:57 a.m.
